description: Erection of a three storey block of six flats with cycle storage.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: Surface Water Strategy (January 2024: 232319), received 08/01/2024. Drawings PL/02, PL/03, PL/04, PL/05, PL/06, PL/07, PL/08 and PL/09, received 07/12/2023. Sustainability and Energy Statement (November 2023: S23-835/SES, Rev.2), received 20/11/2023. Noise Impact Assessment (September 2023: Rev.2A), received 15/09/2023. Air Quality Assessment (June 2023: S23-835/AQA, Rev.2), Landscape Plan (June 2023: S23-835/LP) and Transport Statement (July 2023) with separate cycle storage specifications document, received 11/07/2023. Design and Access Statement (23/02/2023) (partly superseded/ rejected), Construction Fire Safety Plan (Rev.0) and Fire Risk Assessment Construction Phase Plan (April 2023) with appendices, and Location Map, received 17/04/2023.

Condition : 4 - No external utility boxes (for gas and electricity) shall be affixed to the building and any cables, wires, aerials, pipework, meter boxes or flues shall be discreetly integrated into the building and shall not be fixed to any elevation or roof slope facing a highway.

Condition : 5 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any unit within the development hereby approved, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 100.5% reduction in emissions or greater.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.

Condition : 6 - (A) No development above ground level shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority which demonstrate that:

(i)	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
(ii)	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
(iii)	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
(B) The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details under Part A of this condition. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.

Condition : 8 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details in the Surface Water Strategy dated January 2024. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 9 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to demonstrate that adequate ventilation can still be achieved to each unit when windows are shut. If this cannot be achieved, then equivalent ventilation must be provided by other means (e.g. via an unrestricted boost option), equivalent to four air changes per hour in all habitable rooms.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to the front of the site shall have been closed permanently, with the kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement. These shall be maintained in a good condition thereafter in perpetuity.

Condition : 13 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development, a plan indicating the heights (no higher than 0.6 metres within the pedestrian visibility splays along the front boundary), positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority; the boundary treatment shall be erected as approved before the development is first brought into use and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development, finalised details of the arrangements for the storing of waste and recycled materials (including details of how the placing of waste and recycled materials in a suitable location for collection would be undertaken and managed and demonstrating compliance with the Council's Recycling and Refuse Guidelines SPD) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 15 - Prior to first use or occupation of the development full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities that accord with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (for no fewer than 14 bicycles [12 long-stay; 2 short-stay]) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use, The approved facilities shall be thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 16 - Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:

No development shall take place until a preliminary non-intrusive risk assessment (Phase I desk study report) to identify possible areas and sources of land contamination which may exist on the site has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  It will establish what intrusive investigation or site remediation measures may be necessary before the development commences. This report will be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person.

Condition : 17 - Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:

Following the completion of the Phase I desk study report, if intrusive investigations or gas monitoring is recommended, a Phase II site investigation must be undertaken. 

No development other than necessary works to enable intrusive investigations shall take place until a Phase II site investigation report, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

This report shall identify the areas and sources of land contamination that exist on the site and identify the scope of site remediation measures necessary before the development commences.

The investigation shall be carried out by a competent person(s), based on the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) and on-site observations, to identify the extent and nature of contaminants. The initial CSM shall be updated accordingly following a tiered risk assessment based on the findings of the investigation, and where applicable, the report shall include proposals to deal with the identified contamination on site.

Condition : 18 - Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:

If a scheme for remediation is recommended in the Phase II site investigation for the site, no development shall take place until a remediation method statement prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person to specify the works necessary to render the site suitable for its proposed end use, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 19 - During the development:

The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues. 

A revised remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination.

Condition : 20 - Prior to the development is first brought into use:

The agreed scheme for remediation, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 21 - If long term monitoring and maintenance is required following successful completion of approved remedial measures, reports which demonstrate the effectiveness of the monitoring and maintenance shall be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person and submitted to the local planning authority according to an agreed timescale as shall first have been approved under other conditions set out in this planning approval decision notice. 

This shall be conducted in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice.

Condition : 22 - Prior to first occupation, evidence of the development achieving 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 23 - (a) No above ground works shall take place until a Noise Insulation Scheme has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority of a scheme providing for the insulation of the proposed dwellings against the transmission of externally generated aircraft, road and rail noise (and vibration), taking account of any ventilation requirements necessary, in order to ensure that the maximum noise levels permitted within the dwellings will not exceed those that are specified in Table 4 of British Standard 8233:2014 [Living Rooms = 35 dB LAeq, 16 hours; Dining room/area = 40 dB LAeq, 16 hours; Bedroom = 35 dB LAeq, 16 hours during day-time (07:00 - 23:00) and Bedroom = 30 dB LAeq, 8 hours during night-time (23:00 - 07:00)], or any equivalent standards if replaced. 
(b) Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, post-completion noise tests shall be carried out by accredited/approved organisations with competence in environmental noise assessments for residential accommodation and test reports shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Noise tests shall be carried out taking account of worst case environmental conditions, such as easterly operations at Heathrow, peak time traffic flows, wind speed and direction and presence of temperature inversion. Continuous logged data shall be submitted.
